content: Using R code, please extract the name and atomic properties (including atomic number and atomic mass) of the chemical element with an atomic number of 12 from the given JSON object. The JSON object contains a list of elements with their respective names, symbols, atomic numbers, and atomic masses. To extract the specific element, you will need to use multiple-step reasoning and identify it based on its atomic number before retrieving its name and atomic properties. The R code provided uses the jsonlite library to convert the JSON object into a data frame for easier manipulation.

To extract the name and atomic properties of the chemical element with an atomic number of 12, you can follow these steps using R and the `jsonlite` library. Here's a sample R code to achieve this:

```r
# Load the jsonlite library
library(jsonlite)

# Sample JSON object as a string
json_data <- '[
  {"name": "Hydrogen", "symbol": "H", "atomic_number": 1, "atomic_mass": 1.008},
  {"name": "Helium", "symbol": "He", "atomic_number": 2, "atomic_mass": 4.0026},
  {"name": "Lithium", "symbol": "Li", "atomic_number": 3, "atomic_mass": 6.94},
  {"name": "Beryllium", "symbol": "Be", "atomic_number": 4, "atomic_mass": 9.0122},
  {"name": "Boron", "symbol": "B", "atomic_number": 5, "atomic_mass": 10.81},
  {"name": "Carbon", "symbol": "C", "atomic_number": 6, "atomic_mass": 12.011},
  {"name": "Nitrogen", "symbol": "N", "atomic_number": 7, "atomic_mass": 14.007},
  {"name": "Oxygen", "symbol": "O", "atomic_number": 8, "atomic_mass": 15.999},
  {"name": "Fluorine", "symbol": "F", "atomic_number": 9, "atomic_mass": 18.998},
  {"name": "Neon", "symbol": "Ne", "atomic_number": 10, "atomic_mass": 20.180},
  {"name": "Sodium", "symbol": "Na", "atomic_number": 11, "atomic_mass": 22.990},
  {"name": "Magnesium", "symbol": "Mg", "atomic_number": 12, "atomic_mass": 24.305},
  {"name": "Aluminum", "symbol": "Al", "atomic_number": 13, "atomic_mass": 26.982},
  {"name": "Silicon", "symbol": "Si", "atomic_number": 14, "atomic_mass": 28.085}
]'

# Convert JSON to a data frame
elements_df <- fromJSON(json_data)

# Filter the data frame to find the element with atomic number 12
element <- elements_df[elements_df$atomic_number == 12, ]

# Print the extracted element's name and atomic properties
print(element)
```

This code will print the name and atomic properties of the chemical element with an atomic number of 12, which is Magnesium, along with its symbol and atomic mass. Make sure to replace the `json_data` variable with the actual JSON data you have, if it's different from the sample provided.
